attributes.action: Ban The Burkha (also transliterated burqa, burka or burqua from Arabic: برقع‎ burqu‘) from public places in Great Britain.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Islamic holy book, the Qur'an, require both men and women to dress and behave modestly in public.  Therefore, this requirement, called hijab, is not fundamental to the needs of the Muslim community. 
The burkha is a tool of oppression used to alienate and control women under the guise of religious freedom.
It is particularly wrong in Britain, where it is alien to the mainstream culture for someone to walk around wearing a mask.
It is impossible to distinguish between the woman who is choosing to wear a burkha and the girl who has been forced to cover herself and live behind a veil.
We, the undersigned, believe it should be banned.
